definitions: work done or assistance provided to meet someone's needs or requirements
regular inspection and maintenance performed on equipment or vehicles
formal religious ceremony held in a church or religious venue
period of active duty in armed forces or government organizations
complete set of matching dishes and utensils for dining purposes
examples: The restaurant provides excellent service to all its customers
Customer service representatives handled thousands of calls each day
My car needs a service every twelve thousand miles
The technician completed the annual service on the heating system
Sunday morning service begins at ten o'clock sharp
The memorial service honored veterans from the local community
His military service spanned twenty years in the navy
She completed her civil service training last summer
The china service belonged to my grandmother's wedding collection
They purchased a silver service for special dinner occasions

definitions: person serving in the armed forces as active duty military personnel
technician who repairs and maintains equipment or appliances professionally
examples: The serviceman returned home after deployment in the Middle East
Local servicemen received discounts at many area businesses
The appliance serviceman fixed our washing machine within an hour
We called a serviceman when the air conditioning stopped working

definitions: act of performing regular maintenance and repairs on equipment or vehicles
regular payment of interest and principal on loans or debt obligations
examples: Regular servicing keeps machinery running efficiently for years longer
The company specializes in servicing industrial equipment
Servicing the national debt requires billions in annual payments
They struggled with servicing their mortgage during the recession

definitions: individual portion of food or drink prepared for one person
act of providing assistance or performing duties for others
examples: Each serving contains two hundred calories and five grams protein
The recipe yields six generous servings of pasta
Her years of serving the community earned widespread recognition
Serving customers requires patience and good communication skills

definitions: state of being enslaved or subjected to harsh authority requiring unpaid labor
legal right giving someone limited use of another person's property
examples: The prisoners endured years of servitude in labor camps
Historical accounts describe the harsh servitude of enslaved peoples
The property deed included a servitude for utility access
Legal servitude allowed neighbors to use the private road

definitions: automated device that uses feedback to control position, speed, or other mechanical variables
examples: The robot's servo motors provide precise movement control
Radio-controlled planes use servos to control flight surfaces

definitions: tropical plant cultivated for its small edible seeds rich in oil
seeds used as flavoring or oil source in cooking and baking
examples: Farmers harvest sesame when the seed pods turn brown
Sesame grows best in warm climates with moderate rainfall
Sprinkle toasted sesame seeds over the stir-fried vegetables
Tahini paste consists of ground sesame seeds and oil

definitions: celebration or commemoration marking one hundred fifty years since a significant event
examples: The town celebrated its sesquicentennial with parades and historical exhibits
The university's sesquicentennial featured lectures by distinguished alumni

definitions: formal meeting or series of meetings for conducting business or activities
academic period during which classes are held at educational institutions
period devoted to recording music in a studio environment
examples: Congress remained in session until the budget passed
The therapy session lasted fifty minutes every Wednesday
Summer session classes begin in early June this year
She enrolled in two courses during the fall session
The band booked studio session time for their new album
Recording session musicians provided backing tracks for the singer

definitions: group of similar objects that belong or are used together
television or radio receiving equipment with screen and speakers
scenery and props arranged on stage for theatrical performance
collection of distinct mathematical objects considered as a whole
examples: She received a complete set of kitchen knives for her birthday
The chess set had hand-carved pieces made from marble
The old television set finally stopped working after twenty years
They gathered around the radio set to hear the news
Stage crew changed the set between acts of the play
The elaborate set design won awards for theatrical excellence
The set of prime numbers less than ten includes four elements
Students learned about intersection and union of mathematical sets

definitions: unexpected difficulty or reversal that delays progress or success
required minimum distance between a building and property boundaries
examples: The project suffered a major setback when funding was withdrawn
Despite several setbacks, the team completed the mission successfully
Local zoning requires a twenty-foot setback from the street
The house violated setback requirements and needed variance approval

definitions: underground tunnel system where badgers live and raise their young
rectangular block of stone used for paving roads or paths
examples: The badger sett had multiple entrances hidden among the trees
Wildlife officers protected the ancient sett from development
Workers laid granite setts to restore the historic street
The old setts created an attractive but bumpy road surface

definitions: long upholstered seat with back and arms designed for two or more people
examples: The antique settee perfectly complemented the Victorian parlor decor
They placed a small settee at the foot of the bed

definitions: large long-haired dog breed originally trained for hunting and pointing game
person who sets, arranges, or establishes something in a particular way
examples: The Irish setter won best in show at the competition
Red setters require daily exercise and regular grooming
The goal setter helped employees establish achievable career objectives
Type setters arranged metal letters for printing before computers

definitions: physical surroundings or environment where something occurs or exists
metal framework holding a precious stone in jewelry
time and place where a story or narrative takes place
adjustable positions or configurations on a device or system
examples: The restaurant's romantic setting overlooked the moonlit ocean
The conference provided an ideal setting for networking
The diamond's platinum setting enhanced its brilliant sparkle
She chose a vintage setting for her engagement ring
The novel's setting shifts between Victorian London and rural India
Fantasy writers create elaborate settings for their imaginary worlds
Adjust the temperature setting to maintain comfortable room conditions
Camera settings determine exposure and focus for each photograph

definitions: long wooden bench with high back and arms, often with storage space underneath
examples: The old oak settle beside the fireplace seated three people
Antique settles often feature carved decorations and built-in storage

definitions: place where people establish a community and build permanent dwellings
formal agreement resolving a dispute or claim between parties
payment of money owed or final accounting of financial obligations
gradual sinking or subsidence of ground or building foundations
examples: Early settlements along the river grew into major cities
The archaeological dig uncovered an ancient settlement
Both parties reached a settlement before the trial began
The divorce settlement divided assets equally between spouses
Full settlement of the invoice is due within thirty days
Insurance settlement checks arrived six months after the claim
Foundation settlement caused cracks in the basement walls
Engineers monitored settlement of the new bridge supports

definitions: person who moves to a new area to establish permanent residence and develop the land
examples: Early settlers faced harsh winters and food shortages
European settlers established farms throughout the prairie regions

definitions: process of establishing permanent residence in a new location
act of resolving disagreements or finalizing arrangements
gradual sinking or compacting of materials or structures
examples: Settling in a new country requires adjusting to different customs
The family enjoyed settling into their new neighborhood
Settling disputes through mediation saves time and legal costs
They spent hours settling the details of the contract
Settling of the foundation continued for several months
Dust settling after construction revealed the renovation's impact

definitions: way in which equipment or systems are organized and configured
deliberately planned situation intended to deceive or incriminate someone
examples: The computer setup includes three monitors and wireless peripherals
Our office setup promotes collaboration between team members
The police operation was a setup to catch drug dealers
He realized too late that the meeting was a setup

definitions: cardinal number between six and eight representing this quantity
examples: Seven days make one complete week
The recipe serves seven people when properly portioned

definitions: cardinal number equal to ten plus seven
examples: Seventeen students enrolled in the advanced chemistry class
She celebrated her seventeenth birthday with family and friends

definitions: ordinal number indicating position seventeen in a sequence or series
examples: The seventeenth century witnessed major scientific discoveries
He finished seventeenth in the marathon race

definitions: ordinal number indicating position seven in a sequence
musical interval spanning seven scale degrees
examples: The seventh grade students organized a science fair
She arrived seventh in the swimming competition
The dominant seventh chord creates tension needing resolution
Jazz musicians frequently use extended seventh chords

definitions: ordinal number indicating position seventy in a sequence
examples: They celebrated their seventieth wedding anniversary last month
The seventieth percentile represents above-average performance

definitions: cardinal number equal to seven times ten
examples: Seventy percent of the students passed the examination
The temperature reached seventy degrees Fahrenheit today

definitions: compensation package provided when employment is terminated by an employer
act of cutting off or separating something from a whole
examples: The severance package included six months salary and benefits
Employees received severance pay after the factory closure
Severance of the damaged nerve relieved chronic pain
The storm caused severance of power lines throughout town

definitions: act of cutting through or separating something completely from another part
examples: Severing the cable interrupted internet service for hours
The accident resulted in severing of major blood vessels

definitions: quality of being severe, harsh, or extreme in degree or intensity
examples: The severity of the storm forced evacuation of coastal areas
Doctors assessed the severity of his injuries after the accident

definitions: waste water and excrement conveyed in sewers from homes and buildings
examples: The treatment plant processes millions of gallons of sewage daily
Raw sewage contaminated the river after the pipe burst

definitions: underground conduit for carrying waste water and sewage
person who sews fabric or makes clothing
examples: The main sewer runs beneath the street to the treatment plant
Storm sewers prevent flooding during heavy rainfall
The skilled sewer hemmed the dress in under an hour
Professional sewers work in the garment factory

definitions: system of sewers and drains for removing waste water from buildings
examples: The city upgraded its sewerage system to prevent overflow
Modern sewerage infrastructure protects public health

definitions: activity of joining fabric using needle and thread
items being sewn or needlework projects in progress
examples: She learned sewing from her grandmother at age eight
Sewing classes teach basic techniques and pattern reading
Her sewing basket contained several unfinished projects
The sewing on this hem needs to be redone

definitions: biological classification as male or female based on reproductive characteristics
physical activity between individuals involving genital contact for pleasure or reproduction
state of being male or female in terms of social or cultural differences
examples: The doctor determined the baby's sex during the ultrasound
Biological sex involves chromosomes, hormones, and anatomy
Safe sex practices help prevent disease transmission
The couple waited until marriage before having sex
The form asked applicants to indicate their sex
Discrimination based on sex violates employment laws

definitions: prejudice or discrimination based on sex, typically against women
examples: Workplace sexism prevented qualified women from receiving promotions
The campaign addressed sexism in advertising and media

definitions: person who discriminates against others based on their sex or gender
examples: The sexist manager consistently overlooked female employees for advancement
Several sexist comments led to his dismissal from the company

definitions: navigational instrument measuring angular distances between celestial objects for determining position
examples: Sailors used the sextant to navigate by measuring sun angles
The brass sextant belonged to a nineteenth-century ship captain

definitions: musical composition for six performers or the group performing it
examples: The string sextet performed chamber music at the festival
Brahms composed several beautiful sextets for strings

definitions: person responsible for maintaining church property and assisting with burials
examples: The sexton prepared the church for Sunday services
As sexton, he maintained the cemetery grounds and church building

definitions: person's sexual feelings, attractions, behaviors, and identity regarding sexual orientation
examples: Human sexuality encompasses biological, psychological, and social factors
The course explored sexuality across different cultures and time periods

definitions: roughly built hut or cabin typically made from scrap materials
examples: The old fishing shack stood abandoned by the shore
Miners lived in wooden shacks near the excavation site

definitions: metal restraint for securing prisoner's wrists or ankles together
examples: Guards removed the prisoner's shackles during the court appearance
Ancient shackles displayed in the museum weighed several pounds

definitions: silvery food fish that migrates from ocean to rivers for spawning
examples: Commercial fishermen netted shad during the spring spawning run
Grilled shad with lemon makes a delicious seasonal meal

definitions: area of darkness created when light is blocked by an object
degree of darkness or lightness in a particular color
device for blocking light at windows, typically fabric or slats
very small difference or amount of something
examples: We rested in the shade of the large oak tree
The patio umbrella provided welcome shade from hot sun
The artist mixed several shades of blue for the seascape
Choose a shade lighter than your natural hair color
Pull down the shade to block the morning sunlight
Roman shades add elegance to any window treatment
His story differs just a shade from the official version
The temperature dropped a shade below freezing last night

definitions: technique of marking surfaces to show light, shadow, and dimension in artwork
gradual transition in light intensity or color across a surface
examples: The artist's shading technique created realistic three-dimensional effects
Pencil shading requires practice to master different textures
Careful shading of the graph highlighted important data trends
The shading on the map indicated different elevation levels

definitions: dark area or shape produced when an object blocks light
person who closely follows another to observe or learn
slight trace or hint of something barely perceptible
examples: His shadow stretched long across the pavement at sunset
The building cast shadows over the entire parking lot
The new employee will shadow experienced staff for training
A detective shadowed the suspect for three days
There wasn't a shadow of doubt about her innocence
Only a shadow of his former strength remained

definitions: practice of closely following someone to observe and learn their job
process of creating or casting shadows on surfaces
examples: Job shadowing helps students explore different career paths
The intern spent a week shadowing the department manager
Proper shadowing techniques enhance architectural renderings
The shadowing effect made the sculpture appear more dramatic

definitions: long narrow rod or pole forming part of a tool or machine
vertical or inclined passage through a building or underground
narrow beam of light passing through an opening
examples: The drive shaft transfers power from engine to wheels
He replaced the broken shaft on the golf club
The elevator shaft extends from basement to penthouse
Miners descended into the mine shaft each morning
A shaft of sunlight illuminated dust particles in the air
Shafts of light pierced through the cathedral windows

definitions: thick carpet or rug with long rough pile fibers
layered haircut with graduated lengths creating textured appearance
marine bird similar to cormorant with distinctive crest
examples: The seventies shag carpet needed professional cleaning
They replaced the old shag with modern hardwood flooring
Her new shag haircut perfectly framed her face
The hairstylist specialized in modern shag cuts
Shags nested on the rocky coastal cliffs
The green shag dove repeatedly for small fish

definitions: rapid back-and-forth or up-and-down movement often from instability
thick sweet beverage made by blending milk, ice cream, and flavoring
wooden shingle split from logs used for roofing or siding
examples: The earthquake shake lasted thirty seconds but felt longer
She noticed a slight shake in her hands from nervousness
The chocolate shake contained three scoops of ice cream
They ordered burgers and shakes at the drive-in restaurant
Cedar shakes provide natural insulation and weather resistance
The cabin's shake roof needed replacement after the storm
